section.name: Issue Tracking
section.p: Go to SourceForge bug and feature request tracker to see open bugs or to submit new requests.

section.name: Bug reporting
section.p: Please report any found bug in the tracker above. Check carefully that the same item is not already listed in existing bugs.
Please read faqs and mailing list archives before if you are not sure if a behaviour is a bug and if you are using displaytag in the correct way. Post any help request to the user mailing list.

Please do not post bug reports or patches to mailing lists directly! Always submit them to the bug tracker before, this will help us to track and review them. After submitting an item, you are free to discuss it in the develper mailing list (without attaching code or patches to mails).

section.name: Feature requests and patches for new features
section.p: As always, use the tracker to submit any feature request (in the RFE category).
If you modify the tag library adding a new feature you would like to see in the main distribution, open a new RFE and attach the patch to it ( don't sent it to the mailing list ).
If you want to see your patch applied by committers in a short time you should be able to provide the following items:

ol.li: A cvs diff against the latest cvs version (no, a zip file with all the modified sources is not ok)

One or more junit test which tests your new feature. Also be sure to run all the existing testcases to be sure that you are not going to break anything. Look in the src/test directory to understand how to write simple jsp testcases.
Update documentation (xdoc files and/or sample application).

section.p: If all these requirements are met, you patch will be probably accepted soon. If you only provide a zip with the modified files keep in mind that a developer should complete all the other tasks for you before committing any change to cvs, and this could require a long time.
